titleproper.value: Guide to the Tom Savage Papers <num>MSS 124</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Jennifer E. Neal

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2018-06-19T14:01:50</date>

abstract.value: Tom Savage (1948), a native New Yorker, is an American poet and author. He has published several books and magazines, and is most closely associated with the New School as a writer and publisher. This collection documents Savage's poetry dating between 1976 and 1997, with the bulk of the materials ranging from 1992-1997. Materials include print publications and photocopies of poems, lists, and one manuscript.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Tom Savage Papers; MSS 124; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Tom Savage in 1997. The accession number associated with this gift is 1997.124.

Tom Savage, an American poet and author, was born in New York City in 1948. He has published several books and magazines, and is most closely associated with the New School as a writer and publisher. In 1976, he attended the Naropa Institute and co-edited the inaugural issue of <emph render="italic">Roof</emph> magazine with James Sherry. Savage's writing explores the social inequalities of urban life and reflect his interest in Eastern religion and philosophy. He taught workshops at the Poetry Project, Juliard, and Encore Community Center in New York City.
Materials include print publications and photocopies of poems, lists, and one manuscript.
